channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Commodities for the Long Run?
item.description: Asset classes such as commodities have historically had notable diversification benefits for longer-term investors who are concerned with inflation.

item.title: The highest-paying trade jobs in the U.S. include one paying over $100,000 per year—but you’ll have to be comfortable with tight spaces and heights
item.description: With AI threatening to steal corporate jobs and recent graduates finding themselves “unemployable”, trade jobs are becoming increasingly attractive—and lucrative.

item.title: Vanguard’s Former OCIO Clients Must Stand Their Ground
item.description: Vanguard's OCIO clients should be wary of the higher-fee active funds and alternative investments that are now open to them.

item.title: How an ideological war over PrEP threatens preventive services from smoking cessation to contraception to vaccines for half the U.S. population
item.description: More than 150 million Americans now have access to preventive services—and these are popular across the political spectrum.

item.title: Are Your Data Governance and Management Practices Keeping Pace with the AI Boom?
item.description: No matter how sophisticated and expensive a firm's AI tools are, it should not forget that the principle “garbage in, garbage out” (GIGO) applies to the entire investment management process.

item.title: Millennial law grad quit her director job in Monaco to launch a second-hand store with her mom—now she sells designer bags and bling at $3,200 a pop and treats her husband to Audemars Piguet
item.description: “Don’t take a job for the money. Take a job for what you can learn and for the passion,” says Sellier’s founder Hanushka Toni.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: New Hollywood power player David Ellison outlines his ‘essential’ vision for Paramount to transition into a ‘tech hybrid’
item.description: That includes plans to “rebuild” the Paramount+ streaming service.

item.title: Conundrum Cubed: Scope 3 for Financials
item.description: Proxy data and estimates are likely to play an important role in plugging disclosure gaps in financial institutions' Scope 3 emissions.

item.title: The man dubbed ‘Britain’s Warren Buffett’ blames falling vet visits—not his refusal to back Nvidia—for poor performance of U.K.’s biggest fund
item.description: Smith's popular fund has again underperformed the benchmark, prompting him to defend his Nvidia stance once more.
